title: Cart on a hill or in a dip or in a loop

content.question: The figures show a cart moving over the top of a hill (Case 1), moving at the bottom of a dip (Case 2), and moving at the top of a vertical loop (Case 3). In each case, the normal force acting on the car is <math alttext="F sub lowercase n" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></math> and the weight of the car is <math alttext="F sub g" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></math>. In which case is it always true that <math alttext="F sub lowercase n is greater than F sub g" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></math>, and in which case is it always true that <math alttext="F sub lowercase n is less than F sub g" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub lowercase n is greater than F sub g, Always" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Always</mtext></math><math alttext="F sub lowercase n is less than F sub g, Always" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Always</mtext></math>Case 1Case 3

<math alttext="F sub lowercase n is greater than F sub g, Always" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Always</mtext></math><math alttext="F sub lowercase n is less than F sub g, Always" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Always</mtext></math>Case 2Case 1

<math alttext="F sub lowercase n is greater than F sub g, Always" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Always</mtext></math><math alttext="F sub lowercase n is less than F sub g, Always" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Always</mtext></math>Case 2Case 3

<math alttext="F sub lowercase n is greater than F sub g, Always" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Always</mtext></math><math alttext="F sub lowercase n is less than F sub g, Always" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Always</mtext></math>Case 3Case 1

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub lowercase n is greater than F sub g, Always" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Always</mtext></math><math alttext="F sub lowercase n is less than F sub g, Always" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Always</mtext></math>Case 2Case 1

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
